description.plain: Until The Ribbon Breaks, sometimes known as just “UTRB,” is a British band consisting of Pete Lawrie-Winfield, James Gordon and Elliot Wall. The band was founded in Cardiff, Wales in 2012. Their music blends genres like electronic, pop, rock, and hip-hop, but it’s all done with a sharp alternative edge and a dark, sometimes even creepy tone.

body.plain: Until The Ribbon Breaks, sometimes known as just “UTRB,” is a British band consisting of Pete Lawrie-Winfield, James Gordon and Elliot Wall. Their music blends genres like electronic, pop, rock, and hip-hop, but it’s all done with a sharp alternative edge and a dark, sometimes even creepy tone.

songs.full_title: Romeo by Until The Ribbon Breaks
songs.title: Romeo

description.plain:
This poignant track off of A Lesson Unlearnt describes how it feels to be in the aftermath of a relationship. This song refers to the classic tragic love story of Romeo and Juliet by Shakespeare, giving the song an extra romantic edge, the reference, lyrics and musical elements all coming together to create a feeling of sorrow.

In an interview, Pete Lawrie-Winfield, the band’s lead singer, talked about the song:

If there was a line that sums up the whole song, it would be, “You’re been looking for meaning, did you like what you found?” because it’s actually about the chase for a feeling, the concept of love, I suppose, the constant need and lamost addiction to it. It’s asking once you achieve that or attain that, what’s next?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vxG4DcVFbh0

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
First in line
For the wishing well, well, well
For a long time
Can't you tell?
First in line
Give me a new start
Give me a new page

[Chorus]
You see I would have killed Romeo and saved Juliet
But I don't write stories that time won't forget
So won't you pass me the kerosene?
Let's burn to the ground
You've been looking for meaning
Did you like what you found?

[Post-Chorus]
Forgive me, I've been lonely
But it's not like I don't know my way
But I don't know my way

[Verse 2]
Oh look at you all shining
And didn't you do well, well, well, well
For a long time
I could not tell you my secret
I don't know where to go from here
Give me a new page
There are some things that will never change
[Chorus]
You see I would have killed Romeo and saved Juliet
But I don't write stories that time won't forget
So won't you pass me the kerosene?
Let's burn to the ground
You've been looking for meaning
Did you like what you found?

[Post-Chorus]
Forgive me I've been lonely
But it's not like I don't know my way
But I don't know my way

[Bridge]
Oh, Romeo
Oh, Romeo
Oh, Romeo
Oh, Romeo
Oh, Romeo

[Post-Chorus]
Forgive me, I've been lonely
But it's not like I don't know my way
But I don't know my way3EmbedShare URLCopyEmbedCopy

songs.full_title: Goodnight America by Until The Ribbon Breaks
songs.title: Goodnight America

description.plain:
“Goodnight America”, according to frontman Pete Lawrie Winfield, is “pro America, anti creeping nausea, pro choice, anti anything else.” The song gained some traction after it was used on Sacha Baron Cohen’s 2018  political satire series Who Is America?.

The music video contains footage from Donald Trump rallies, police violence, nuclear bomb tests, and more. The song in particular takes aim at Donald Trump, who has been a very controversial presidential candidate for the 2016 Election, and bashes the ideas that he has had such as ‘building a wall to keep the Mexicans out’, as well as him gloating of his wealth.

In an article from Pitchfork, Lawrie stated:

It would have been nice to have seen through my daydream, to have drawn the blinds, battened down the hatches and pretended that the country that I now call home, a country that I love, wasn’t falling victim to some kind of cartoonish nightmare. This song is pro America, anti creeping nausea, pro choice, anti anything else. To dissect it too much, to feel the need to explain it seems unnecessary. We are all privy to the same information now, we are all awake.

songs.embed_content: Read “Goodnight America” by Until The Ribbon Breaks on Genius

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Over and over, so right wing that you might tip over
I need a hospital, I need a clinic
I need a reason not to be a cynic
I'm so straight, I'm so white
My God, I'll sleep well tonight
Look at this retard, he's so dumb
This is America, sucking on its thumb

[Pre-Chorus]
Let's fire up the electric chair
Three cheers for the billionaire
Coca-Cola and your favourite prayer
Goodnight, goodnight, goodnight

[Chorus]
One more night
Beneath the stars, beneath the stripes
One more night
Goodnight, goodnight, goodnight
Goodnight America

[Refrain]
(Woo)
(Woo)
Goodnight America
(Woo)
(Woo)
[Verse 2]
Over and over
We've got guns, you should all come over
Actually, just some of you, let's build a wall
Actually, I'm rich! So fuck you all
A thousand bullets, oh, what a sight
My God, I'll sleep well tonight
Ambien, Ambien, sing me to sleep
This is America, you are what you eat

[Pre-Chorus]
Let's fire up the electric chair
Three cheers for the billionaire
Coca-Cola and your favourite prayer
Goodnight, goodnight, goodnight

[Chorus]
One more night
Beneath the stars, beneath the stripes
One more night
Goodnight, goodnight, goodnight
Goodnight America

[Bridge]
Baby, baby, baby, baby
I wish you all the best
Baby, baby
I'll be in the corner with my bulletproof vest, yes
[Pre-Chorus]
Let's fire up the electric chair
Three cheers for the billionaire
Gunpowder​ in the desert air
Goodnight, goodnight, goodnight

[Chorus]
One more night
Beneath the stars, beneath the stripes
One more night
Goodnight, goodnight, goodnight
Goodnight America

[Chorus]
One more night
Beneath the stars, beneath the stripes
One more night
Goodnight, goodnight, goodnight

[Outro]
(Woo)
(Woo)
Goodnight America5EmbedShare URLCopyEmbedCopy
